question: What is the cause of Krabbe disease?
ideal_answer: Globoid cell leukodystrophy (GLD), or Krabbe disease, is an inherited, neurologic disorder that results from deficiency of a lysosomal enzyme, galactosylceramidase.

snippets.text: Krabbe disease (KD) is a rare disease caused by the deficiency of β-galactocerebrosidase.
Globoid cell leukodystrophy (GLD), or Krabbe disease, is an inherited, neurologic disorder that results from deficiency of a lysosomal enzyme, galactosylceramidase.
Krabbe disease is a rare neurodegenerative genetic disorder caused by deficiency of galactocerebrosidase.
